page.title: 10HEDGEROWS AROUND CLOPTON
page.content: The village of Clopton is surrounded by farmland and rough grazing land. The hedgerows lining the sides of the roads are basically untended and there is evidence of a number of dead elm trees. Where footpaths cross the road they have mainly fallen into disuse and many are not signposted and have become overgrown. There are quite a few oak tres growing in the hedgerows that surround the fields along with brambles, hazel, nettles, hogweed, marshmallows, white campion, hemlock, yarrow and shepherds purse. As the farmers require larger fields these hedgerows are being gradually dug up.
